{{unreferenced|date=May 2011}} {{Infobox TV channel | name = MTV Flanders | logofile = MTV_Logo_2010.svg | logosize = 140px | launch = 16 February 2004<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mtvnetworks.be/nl/company/mtvnetworks |title=MTV Networks: Drie zenders, twee kanalen |publisher=mtvnetworks.be}}</ref> | picture format = [[576i]] [[SDTV]] ([[16:9]]) | share = | share as of = | share source = | sister names = | timeshift names = [[Nickelodeon (Netherlands & Flanders)]] (February 2004 - 3 October 2011) |audience = |web = [http://nl.mtv.be MTV.BE] | terr serv 1 = | terr chan 1 = | sat serv 1 = | sat chan 1 = | cable serv 1 = | cable chan 1 = | cable serv 2 = [[Telenet Digital TV]] Flanders | cable chan 2 = 35 | cable serv 3 = [[Telenet Digital TV]] Brussels | cable chan 3 = 125 | iptv serv 1 = [[Belgacom TV]] Flanders | iptv chan 1 = 162 | iptv serv 2 = [[Belgacom TV]] Brussels & Wallonia | iptv chan 2 = 189 }} '''MTV Flanders''' is the [[Flanders|Flemish]] version of video transmitter [[MTV]]. The MTV audience is somewhat older than that of [[The Music Factory|TMF]], and focuses more on alternative music.
==MTV Europe== Since 1987, in Flanders [[MTV Europe]] broadcast. All programs were [[Video jockeys]] from various European countries presented in the [[English people|English]]. Similarly, [[Marcel Vanthilt]] VJ on MTV from 1987 to 1990.
==MTV Netherlands== In February 2004, [[MTV Europe]] and was replaced [[MTV Netherlands]] on Flemish cable. Unlike MTV Netherlands, in the Netherlands 24/24 hour broadcast, sent MTV Netherlands from 18 hours to 06 hours on the channel where [[Nickelodeon (Netherlands & Flanders)|Nickelodeon Flanders]] daytime exceptions. MTV was when Dutch programming, but Flemish commercial breaks. Thus came the commercials and programs never equal in Flanders. On December 1, 2006 was broadcast on MTV in 3 hours shortened, because [[Nickelodeon (Netherlands & Flanders)|Nickelodeon Flanders]] additional broadcast time was 3 hours, until MTV began to broadcast from 20 hours to five hours in the morning.
==Flemish-orientated MTV== In December 2008, the MTV style of custom and one could speak of becoming a Flemish MTV. In 2009, the program gradually different. In April 2009 there was also an MTV chat like this for years with [[TMF Flanders]] is. MTV in July 2009 was again thrown into a new style, same as other European MTV channels. And gradually it seems the programming of MTV and MTV Flanders Netherlands no longer together. In January 2010 MTV Flanders was also a private site and is no longer sent to the Dutch. Also, since 2010 the launch of MTV 20 hours, the first 2 programs from MTV and TMF Flanders Flanders announced. That is happening at TMF Flanders. In September 2010 is also the first Flemish MTV Program: TUCS (Tasty Urban Crazy Stuff). This is presented by [[Studio Brussel|StuBru]] [[DJ]] [[Schoeters Siska]].
==Extension MTV Flanders==
On May 31, 2011 by [[MTV Networks Benelux|MTV Networks Belgium]] announced that MTV & [[Nickelodeon (Netherlands & Flanders)|Nickelodeon Flanders]] will broadcast both around the clock, which means they are no longer a channel will share. This means that by October 4, 2011 MTV Flanders fully digital and can be seen no longer the analogue TV offering occurs. [[Nickelodeon (Netherlands & Flanders)|Nickelodeon]], the time left on the analog TV channel to take.
